pageContext.title: All upbringing cards
pageContext.description: A full listing of cards under this tag

front.name: City
prompts: Make a deal or haggle over details
Navigate a physical or social labyrinth
Gauge someone's wants or needs

back.name: City
back.desc:
//"...For the right price." -- Basler
Not everything can be reduced to a simple transaction, but city dwellers sometimes try anyway. Some of what you've seen has made you numb. The city eats people whole, so much so that you can be blind to suffering.
prompts: Compromise a principle or ideal for expedience
Overcomplicate a plan or solution
Look past pain or hurt rather than soothe it
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Country
front.desc:
//"Take a deep breath of that country air!" -- Tana
You grew up among farmers, ranchers, or other folk who lived off the land. You might have lived in a tight-knit community, or been miles away from the nearest neighbor.
You're familiar with the plants or animals of your region. You're used to putting in an honest day's work.
You've learned to approach situations via effort.
prompts: Endure wearying labor, physical or emotional
Devise practical solutions to hard problems
Understand someone's unspoken hardships

back.name: Country
back.desc:
//"Smells like cow breakfast" -- Basler
Not everyone appreciates the necessity of hard work. But sometimes, just plowing through isn't the right answer either. You're used to getting down in the mud, but it's important to reach for the stars as well.
prompts: Condemn someone for shunning hard work
Balk at complex explanations or solutions
Sacrifice tomorrow's hopes for today's needs
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Frontier
front.desc:
//"The forest demands self-sufficiency" -- Woody
You grew up at the edge of civilization, whether a harsh desert, a lonely mountain, a deep forest, or somewhere equally remote. You learned to fend for yourself from a young age.
You can hunt, trap, or otherwise live off the land. Your life is a careful balance of trust and caution.
You've learned to approach situations through resourcefulness.
prompts: Come well-prepared for harsh conditions
Find what you need in the environment
Anticipate danger

back.name: Frontier
back.desc:
//"Well the forest sounds pretty demanding" -- Basler
When much of your life is preoccupied with taking care of yourself and your needs, it's easy to lose sight of others' wants. Carefulness and selfishness are matters of degree.
prompts: Prioritize your immediate needs over the plans or stores of others
Disregard the scruples and niceties of civilized folk
Imagine a threat in every shadow
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Insular
prompts: Solve a problem using your peoples' ways
Ask naive but insightful questions
Reveal hidden knowledge or exclusive experience

back.name: Insular
back.desc:
//"Everything's different out here. That's why it's called a cloister" -- Basler
Your early life didn't prepare you for the sheer variey of people and things the world has to offer. You might make a basic blunder, or ask a troubling question. When in doubt, there might be someone you rely on for answers, or you may rely on your upbringing's incomplete picture of things.
prompts: Violate unspoken rules or cultural taboos
Cause conflict through misunderstanding
Fall back on a trusted authority
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Noble
prompts: Do what is right and proper, no matter what
Hold others to a high standard
Leverage your power and authority

back.name: Noble
back.desc:
//"As opposed to ironclad thugs lording it over the peasants?" -- Basler
Not everyone benefits from, or approves of, a system of aristocracy or nobility. People might assume you look down on them, or that you'll abuse the power you hold. And all too often, they'll be right.
prompts: Mire a situation in pomp and etiquette
Demand sacrifices you haven't made
Lord it over your perceived lessers
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Nomadic
prompts: Recall a story that will bring people together or solutions to light
Bring a fresh perspective to a situation
Forge a path to acceptance or compromise

back.name: Nomadic
back.desc:
//"Do these wagon wheels fall off often?" -- Emory
Life on the road is never easy. It can be tempting to avoid responsibility or relationships through an early departure. It's also easy to mistake your breadth of experience for depth, and fail to hear wiser voices.
prompts: Overestimate your own wisdom or experiences
Leave a half-solved problem behind and move on
See people as faces in the crowd, not individuals
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Solitary
prompts: Shut out distractions
Present a reassuring facade
Keep moving even when hope is lost

back.name: Solitary
back.desc:
//"You've left yourself alone too long" -- Tana
Without experiencing what other people in your life can do, you may fear what you need most from them: an outlet. When you act distant, others will reciprocate.
prompts: Accumulate emotional debt
Keep your reservations unspoken
Leave others behind to fend for themselves
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

front.name: Underclass
prompts: Stand up for yourself and those like you
Rally those who question themselves
Obtain your needs through a social network

back.name: Underclass
back.desc:
//"When everyone hates you, it's hard not to hate them back." -- Basler
Sometimes, circumstances push people to a breaking point. Other times, doing the right thing becomes impossible, and you're left with doing the necessary thing.
prompts: Lash out at threats to your ego
Build yourself up in the eyes of the impressionable
Run afoul of those in power
back.rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.
